intro: Psychotria costanensis var. pubibracteata, commonly known as the pubibracteate psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds, typical of many Rubiaceae species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
